titleInfo.title: Letter from Peter Elwin Wrench, Dymoke Lyster, and George Skipp, East India Company Agent and council at Bussora [Basra], to Benjamin Jervis, East India Company Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter reprimands the recipient for sending damaged cloth to Basra and is ordered to take it back and dispose of it himself. There is a repeat of the Presidency's order not to rupture relations with Meer Mahanna [MÄ«r Muhanna]. The sale of woollens to the Caun [Karim Khan] is discussed, as is the business of a private merchant and the lower prices cloth is sold at in Basra. There are instructions to approach the Khan about the letter sent to him by the Agent and to send any surplus cash to Bombay.
